info.label: Computer Science Student
info.brief: I'm currently an undergraduate studying computer science and economics. I'm passionate about using technology to solve real problems, and I love learning new things that help me approach problems in unique ways. As a result, I always have at least one active side project and am in the process of learning at least one new thing, be it a programming language, framework, or something else entirely!

projects.title: airDrive
projects.summary: Independently built proof-of-concept cloud storage website that combined the usability of Dropbox with the security of file sharding and end-to-end encryption.
highlights: Files were sharded across a network of users' machines using Storj.
Participated in Breakthrough-Lab, a summer entrepreneurship program at Brown University.

projects.title: jGrader
projects.summary: Led a small team in building a website that enabled high school teachers to virtually collect, execute, and grade computer science assignments written in Java.
highlights: Was used by hundreds of teachers and thousands of students with virtually no marketing.

projects.title: ProcessWatch
projects.summary: Co-developed process.watch, a website that assisted cloud service providers in monitoring server statuses through email-based notifications.
highlights: Sold stake to local cloud service provider.

history.summary: Software development intern on the tour purchase team at Education First.
highlights: Solved bugs and built features in the internal CRM used by over 500 salespeople.
Built an administration tool from scratch to manage the types of available tour customizations.
Independently built an auditor to draw insights into the customizations customers requested.

history.summary: Teaching assistant for Accelerated Introduction to Computer Science (Fall 2016), Introduction to Software Engineering (Spring 2017), and Artificial Intelligence (Fall 2017).
highlights: Created and updated assignments for classes with a cumulative 281 students.
Guided and mentored students through these assignments on a weekly basis.

history.summary: Web development intern for Rhode Island's Office of Digital Excellence.
highlights: Sole developer of GetOutdoorsRI, a website which encourages Rhode Islanders to explore local parks.
Built on a Drupal site originally developed by the state of Missouri.
Project commissioned by the Rhode Island governor.

history.summary: Third software developer for a startup focused on digitizing the K-12 experience.
highlights: Solved bugs and built features in SchoolBee's web directory software, which is used by over 3700 students and their families.
Developed an automated view system to improve the speed of reads from a Mongo database.

recognition.title: Eagle Scout
recognition.summary: Led volunteers in mapping several local cemeteries; only awarded to 5% of Boy Scouts.

recognition.title: Intel STS Semifinalist
recognition.summary: Researched object oriented databases; 1 of 300 students recognized.
